intro: Galium × ochroleucum var. ambiguum, commonly known as the variable wood sorrel, is a hybrid plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped with a pale green to white underside. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in horticultural settings.
